bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 79 (Monday, May 8, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ISSA:H.R. 2400.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3: To regulate commerce withforeign nations, and among the several states, and with theIndian tribes.[Page H4186]

item.latestTitle: Access to Insurance for All Americans Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Indian, Insular and Alaska Native Affairs.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

item.text:
This bill allows an individual who is not a federal employee to enroll in the Federal Employee Health Benefits Program, unless the individual: (1) is enrolled, or eligible to enroll, in a different public health insurance program; (2) is a member of the uniformed services; or (3) is not a citizen or national of, or lawfully present in, the United States.

An employer may make a contribution on behalf of such an individual, but no government contribution may be provided.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to allow individuals who are not Federal employees to enroll in the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program, and for other purposes.

item.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to allow individuals who are not Federal employees to enroll in the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program, and for other purposes.
To amend title 5, United States Code, to allow individuals who are not Federal employees to enroll in the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
